data.description: Our vision is to transform how the world uses information to enrich life for all. Micron Technology is a world leader in innovating memory and storage solutions that accelerate the transformation of information into intelligence, inspiring the world to learn, communicate and advance faster than ever.Micron’s RAM (RDA and Metrology) group is responsible for advanced process control and precision measurement techniques that are critical to semiconductor manufacturing. The team focuses on defect detection, inline metrology, and signal analysis to ensure process stability and product quality. By leveraging statistical methodologies and automation systems, the RAM team drives continuous improvement and supports the development of next-generation memory technologies.We are seeking a highly motivated Process Integration Intern to join our RAM team in Boise, ID. This internship offers hands-on experience in semiconductor process integration, with a focus on in-fab measurement performance, RDA signal analysis, and process control optimization. You’ll be assigned a project designed to span the duration of your 3-month internship, with training provided to ensure safe and effective participation in cleanroom fabrication environmentsResponsibilitiesAnalyze defect and metrology data to identify process trends and anomalies.Support process control initiatives using SPC and DOE methodologies.Investigate deviations in measurement results and propose corrective actions.Collaborate with engineers to improve measurement accuracy, tool matching, and data integrity.Assist in tool health monitoring and calibration routines.Work with fab automation systems to troubleshoot data collection and integration issues.Take initiative to drive your assigned project to completion.Present findings in a verbal presentation near the end of the internship.Minimum QualificationsJunior-level status in Electrical Engineering, Material Science, Physics, Chemical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, or related fields.Must be a current student and not graduating before September 2026.Passion for working in a fast-paced, high-tech environment.Ability to manage multiple tasks and prioritize effectively.Strong technical, analytical, and communication skills.Proficiency in Microsoft Office and JMP.A mindset for continuous improvement and creative problem solving.Ability to recognize and escalate process anomalies with urgency.Preferred QualificationsSolid understanding of SPC (Statistical Process Control) and DOE (Design of Experiments).Experience with scripting, programming, or visualization tools (Python, Java, Tableau, Matlab).Strong data intuition and visualization skills.Familiarity with data collection systems, warehousing, and cleansing.Hands-on experience in data analytics and database querying.As a world leader in the semiconductor industry, Micron is dedicated to your personal wellbeing and professional growth. Micron benefits are designed to help you stay well, provide peace of mind and help you prepare for the future. We offer a choice of medical, dental and vision plans in all locations enabling team members to select the plans that best meet their family healthcare needs and budget. Micron also provides benefit programs that help protect your income if you are unable to work due to illness or injury, and paid family leave. Additionally, Micron benefits include a robust paid time-off program and paid holidays. For additional information regarding the Benefit programs available, please see the Benefits Guide posted on micron.com/careers/benefits.Micron is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, age, national origin, citizenship status, disability, protected veteran status, gender identity or any other factor protected by applicable federal, state, or local laws.To learn about your right to work click here.To learn more about Micron, please visit micron.com/careersFor US Sites Only: To request assistance with the application process and/or for reasonable accommodations, please contact Micron’s People Organization at hrsupport_na@micron.com or 1-800-336-8918 (select option #3)Micron Prohibits the use of child labor and complies with all applicable laws, rules, regulations, and other international and industry labor standards.Micron does not charge candidates any recruitment fees or unlawfully collect any other payment from candidates as consideration for their employment with Micron.AI alert: Candidates are encouraged to use AI tools to enhance their resume and/or application materials. However, all information provided must be accurate and reflect the candidate's true skills and experiences. Misuse of AI to fabricate or misrepresent qualifications will result in immediate disqualification.
